_header: Now must I need part out of your presence
Subjects: envoys; lovers, absence/separation of; lover’s lament; complaints
_description: A Compleynt, possibly by the Duke of Suffolk — four stanzas rhyme royal including one-stanza envoy

BodFair16.First Lines:
Now must I nede part out of your presenceWhiche causeth me to lyue
                    in gret dystresse…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…I wyl be truly hers in euery placeBesechyng her accept me to
                    her grace
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
BodFair16.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “An English Friend of Charles d’Orleáns.” 
             PMLA
         26 (1911): 142-180: 162-3.
